dHVjwoh5T3J8ISV0ha8sWg.text: This is my favorite restaurant in Edinburgh. I love mussels, and this place makes some GREAT mussels. Huge tureens - you can get full or half kilo pot - of fresh mussels cooked in several different flavor bases.   I tried the Shallot (white wine, garlic and shallots), which was divine! I was very curious about the Moroccan and Mexican pots and will try one next time I am in town. They also have the most delicious fresh baked crusty bread, for dipping in the broth.   We had chilled Oysters to start - with a bottle of wine and good friends - perfect evening and perfect meal!

DU8pQGAOCt0cMkm0EYI-WQ.text: While on a short visit to Edinburgh a friend and I wandered into Mussel Inn in search of something to satisfy our seafood craving.   The ambiance in casual and relaxed without being too informal. Our server was brilliant and very knowledgeable about everything they served. I cant have dairy, but was desperate for the seafood pasta. He suggested that he would have a chat with the chef and - voila - I got seafood pasta with a dairy-free red pepper sauce. This goes down as a HUGE plus in my book. We also started with a huge pot of steamed mussels which were heavenly and a great (but inexpensive) bottle of white wine.  This place is everything I love about a restaurant. The staff is casual yet attentive, the food is simple and spot on, the prices are reasonable, the ambiance is relaxed and not rushed. I look forward to returning the next time Im in Edinburgh.

Tlbgiud6prqgeNtql5zh7g.text: Best chicken noodle soup ever. Fantastic steak over looking the plaza. It was hot and sunny a perfect afternoon.

qn3lQfxo4AK2ZXJu0lclZw.text: The food was just ok. There was not a lot of flavor in the food. Seafood chowder was pretty good but was pretty watered down.

21MBAsbmPs6-IJqZWuwLRQ.text: The Mussel Inn offers great food, competitive prices and a superb location. I came here the other day for the fabulous lunch deal where I chose a bowl of mussels with fries and a glass of white wine for only 7.50, what a bargain! Service was really quick and I think that this menu is designed for people of their work break so the fast service ensures they get back on time, how considerate! The mussels were amazing if a little bit messy to eat, but I'm really messy anyway. The portion was large and the red pepper dressing I opted for was amazing.  We sat outside and I actually felt like I was on holiday watching all the people walking along Rose Street, it was a glorious day!

18PSBPE2hBymiqg_QLAsGw.text: Reluctantly tried mussels for the first time here two years ago and I've been coming here ever since! Total convert. The Dijon and Leek is by far the best flavour, but why stick to one!? Its so inexpensive my boyfriend and I usually order 3-4 half kilos to share. The other favorites are moroccan and blue cheese. But PLEASE PLEASE if you do go, order the crab salad it is heaven!

YIJdFOYU_5m3mKgBglayQg.text: Best mussels I've had. Had the most popular ones, shallot in white wine sauce. Friendly staff and lunch until 5pm for 7.95 includes mussels or chowder, a side of sallad or chunky fries and glass of wine or soda. Bargain! Perfect for a shopping break, It's not the most cozy room but that's the only negative comment I could think of, Don't miss this gem in Edinburgh.

1lB1TNY4mtEUTDKvu4Hx4w.text: Wow!  Great mussels, super friendly staff. They were helpful with our 7 year old, letting us get a half portion of fish and chips, bringing crayons, and chatting with her.  We both got the lunch special, one with leeks and one with shallots.  Both were very tasty and fresh.  They come with steak fries and bread, and a glass of wine.  The salad that came with the fish was crisp and lovely.  If you could put these mussels with french-style bread and fries, it would be a perfect 5 stars.

mjcFgGPkIa_wEkLKm3F43Q.text: I would travel all the way to Edinburgh for their seafood pasta -- absolutely delicious....  Good service and actually pretty reasonable given the quality of food. Would return.

HL9xLWSkcsld74q3ryW1OA.text: The Mussel Inn hosts some high quality fish based dishes. Such high quality is present in the mussel dishes they serve.   Nestling in a big rustic pot, available in plenty of delicious varieties (Shallot being my choice), and accompanied by some chunky bread are the Mussel Inn's showpiece: you guessed it, Mussels. If your feeling macho you can even order a kilo of the unsightly gems, around 12 for that liberty.  One word of warning: you may arrive smelling of sweet perfume and with freshly washed skin, but by the time you exit your clothes will stink of garlic infused cooking oil and other kitchen smells.   It's all part of a decent dining experience though.

photos.caption: Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

MIdfp_Y4A8n8Gt-xVwGLEg.text: I gathered that on my very first visit to the Mussel Inn I should really sample the mussels. I am a huge seafood fan, but the thought of eating things out of shells, especially mussel shells for some reason fills me with dread. I also walked into a chipshop once and witnessed a really fat man gorging them out of a glass jar and that kind of put me off for life.  However, I decided to stop being petulant and get stuck in. We actually got there just in time for the lunchtime quickie menu which runs from 12-2.30pm on weekdays and comes in at a very reasonable 7.50. The restaurant itself is nice and spacious, the tables are well spaced and there is plenty of room for a bit of privacy whilst eating- I hate being jammed in a restaurant and listening to the couple next to me arguing.  I had the bowl of mussels with red pepper sauce and a glass of white wine. You could choose from mussels with a range of sauces or seafood chowder which my mum had, and she said it was amazing! The mussels looked and smelt beautiful, but there is just something about them that I can't get to grips with and I ended up leaving quite a lot of the dish, but with absolutely no disrespect to the chef who cooked them beautifully and the sauce was so yummy I dipped quite a few slices of bread in!   We were in and out within the hour, perfect for our quick shopping pit stop. Next time, no mussels for me!

photos.caption: Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

27EFSonUodjdQLfImlPJVw.text: Mmmmm, I like mussels. I know some people get a bit squeamish about mussels because they just look a bit squishy and like there's a bit too much going on inside them, but quite honestly there's nothing I like better than a nice lunch or dinner involving mussel chomping. I think it's also the novelty of prising open shells and scooping up the sauce which makes me warm to a good mussel dish, as it makes the whole experience extra fun. Now I've made myself sound like an infant that needs to be entertained while she's eating....anyway, if you're passionate about mussels and other related seafoodie delights, the Mussel Inn is a reliably great place to come to on Rose St.  Always busy, and with sharp service, the Mussel Inn has a good friendly feel to it, and the menu has a brilliant range of mussels by the kilo or half kilo, which you can team with a range of sauces. There are also lots of scallops options, as well as oysters and some really tasty starters to be had too.

6HiWFBfXDYDWR2fXQrB0RA.text: I'm still too ashamed to return to this restaurant.   On what was supposed to be a study break in my first year of university my friend and I instead opted for a spot of afternoon drinking. I was missing my boyfriend who was studying in London at the time and my buddy was looking to cheer me up. Four or five drinks later we stumbled into the Mussel Inn because clearly seafood would help out our alcohol lined stomachs. We ate mussels and clams and basket after basket of bread. I remember raving about the garlicky taste and drunkenly asking the waiter to compliment the chef. We also drank some more... I have vague memories of being very loud and asking to play with a nearby tables toddler. They said no.   Two hours later I was on the Sleeper train to London...

UsZoOpVjizxzEf20fgVSpw.text: The thing about mussels is that no matter where you get them from, they seem to taste the same every time, with the only real indicator of quality being the level of food poisoning / diarrhoea you find yourself with the following morning. Because of this, I rarely bother with them even though I find mussels incredibly tasty, but The Mussel Inn's lunchtime deal was just too good to resist on a recent visit.  To be controversial, I actually went for the chowder instead of the mussels, and found it to be utterly fantastic and full of fishy goodness. I wasn't in the mood for wine so just had a coke while E-Bot slugged back her glass of white, but with a big bowl of fries on the side as well, the 7.50 price was an absolute steal.

L6bhWzB03_rscsxI7B5S1Q.text: We came. We saw. We got food poisoning. Visited last week while on vacation. The food tasted excellent, we each ordered various dishes. I personally loved their blue cheese mussel recipe. For maximum enjoyment try pairing the mussels with a cold glass of water as you vomit them back up three hours later. 3/5 barfs.

b3PN_hJMNL1vr0rNhjTgPw.text: went here for new years eve and it was great - busy but in a good way, bustling and fun, had the mussels - of course and they were delicious, the food was great. great bread, all of the food was good. the inside is a bit like a cafe style rather than posh restaurant but that's what gives it it's character. loved it and would def go back again every year!

Uo1y0A-pcjRaw8u7OcqcWw.text: This came recommended from a tiny popup-map guidebook we picked up, and it didn't disappoint mostly.   The starters were very good, but I was astounded to see that queen scallops are about the size of my smaller fingernails (and i'm a girl!!!). The mussels were good too, but they didn't leave enough of the cooking juice in as the Belgians do and that was a shame.   Generally food was good. The only real disappointment was that for the whole evening, and indeed the next day too, our clothes smelled so horribly of fish that it was nearly unbearable!!

CRaD4SI77-LitU3M0eLlkg.text: Five years ago my wife, my 13 year old son and I stumbled upon this restaurant during the Edinburgh Festival and had a great time eating their mussels. We were impressed with their food and hospitality. Fast forward to this year and my wife and I are celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary in Edinburgh and we decide that our first stop will be the Mussel Inn Restaurant. The staff to celebrate our anniversary gave us a dessert trio on the house!! They are the best here, knowledgeable, kind and a great eating experience. We'll be back!

SXoI4eL34gP49vaVVPkFxw.text: Cant beat the kilo pots of mussels. especially with cumin. love some of their seafood soup as well. tend to go for seafood rather than fish here but have had great sea bass in the past.

oZklyqQSmn0HcBcsarTomg.text: Stunning Seafood, certainly best in Edinburgh, very reasonable prices

ve4irxldrwU_CJHUGgvLiw.text: The lunch I had yesterday here is one of the best meals I have in Edinburgh. The mussels as starter is cooked greatly just as the pasta. Surely I will recommend the restaurant to my friends who will visit Edinburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Great pasta

lJk4aU8r1wG-KHOHFzPNbA.text: Make sure you made reservation before u eat!!! Lol cuz we were gonna have dinner there ,and we just went..and they told us there is not available seat so we made a reservation for tmr dinner! The service is good, I ordered a fish as main course, and we both ordered a dozen of oyster!! The oyster is fresh!! My cousin ordered lobster something, and that was delicious!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Oyster!!!
Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. My main course .... Not my appetite thou...

jjHofqmfmbrmfeZyIZQ4kA.text: Fresh Mussels! Reasonable prices! It is not easy to find a good restaurant in the city center of Edinburgh not too expensive and serving decent food: Mussel Inn does so! The mussels are big and fresh. We got then with the shallot and cream sauce, which was great. We also ordered some fries, but they were just ok. 30 pounds for (excellent) mussels and (so-so) fries for two and three glasses of wine served by a friendly staff: not cheap but not crazy expensive as in many other places nearby. Definite a good choice!

R0RCBcA1UG5R3Odh-buQzg.text: Absolutely LOVED it :)  My Favorite Fish place in Scotland was Scotts in Largs , but Mussel Inn almost changed my mind! We had the hot sea food platter , the sauce was really good , the vriety of fish was great" the mussels were yummm! and we had king prawns as starters and the were good too! one last dish was seafood past , which i loved but i would have preferred the sauce to be a bit thicker! I def. recommend it , it is always quite busy so try to book in advance

photos.caption: Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

0lfWlQyiiO3zgXzo35NkKQ.text: The Mussel Inn is a solid bet for a cheap lunch. I'm gluten free so the bread is off limits (but I remember from before eating about 3 baguettes worth with my mussels). They do tend to cram you in so probably not the best bet for a romantic meal but for a great cheap lunch with lovely fresh food, then its a good choice.  Mussels, chips and a glass of wine/beer/soft drink is 7.95. Non mussel eaters can have cullen skint. Mussels are fresh and well prepared, with lots of options of sauce. I like the white wine and shallot and it does tend to be my default choice. I did find that this visit, I had a lot of closed mussels in my portion which isn't ideal so only 3 stars for this visit but the rest of the family enjoyed their cullen skink.  I'm now as wowed as I was when I first discovered it in Glasgow (they were better at filling the bread basket then) but for a decent lunch in the centre of town, then it is worth a visit.

aQovNDMdBsvR95go2tmSwg.text: Been here for twice. Tried shallot, morocco and roasted pepper flavours of mussels. My flavourite is the roasted pepper one with its spice and a hint of sweetness. It may taste strange to some people though. My friend hated it. The seafood pasta thing's taste is not bad, but it is not worthy its price. Just try the mussel pot, it's the best :)

r65YngVLYfyNIbJKY1tsEA.text: Meh.  Bland sauce. Small mussels. So so wine.  Read the reviews and was excited to try, but underwhelmed.

L6IPHn_f3FxXkrRZTVvc7w.text: Scotland and seafood = amazing! A bloody gem of a seafood restaurant in Rose st,Edinburgh this unassuming little restaurant is packed with seafood greatness. Of course I had mussels which were cooked to perfection with crusty white bread and garlic white wine cream sauce I was in heaven! Simply perfect. My friends had the prawn linguini which was smashing as well. So simple,so tasty, so satisfied! I had heard that the steaks are actually superstars here as well but didn't get to try it. Enjoy!

TjvqtcIvGwYL0fqflcCfVA.text: Very tasty mussels and fries:). Service was also excellent!  My husband I ordered the same and you get a lot of mussels and bread to soak up the delicious broth.  My son ordered the steak and it was cooked to perfection.   It was also reasonably priced:)

-NlRc5-RUWwzlkQyB3G8Wg.text: I've popped in a few times over the years, and while not blown away by anything they do, it's always been a safe bet for a decent lunch.  I nipped in for what's billed as a 'lunchtime quickie' today and have to say it wasn't too bad overall, given you get mussels, a small glass of wine, a bowl of chips and bread and butter for 7.50.  You do have to have your wits about you though, as the mussels that normally come in either kilo or half kilo sizes are reduced to a smaller bowl size for this deal option. You might be a bit disappointed with this if you're expecting the usual metal pot to arrive on your table.  That leaves me with my only minor gripe - the smell! There was a less than wholesome undertone in the air today that, had it been any stronger, would have had me squeezing the lemon wedge onto my top lip (in CSI pre-autopsy stylee) rather than into my bowl of mussels.  Hopefully just a bad day in the kitchen.

OM1iYj1VwBkc53rrj3yRwA.text: The best and the freshest muscles in town. It's recommended to go early as they run out very quickly. I also has the sea bass and that was remarkable as well.

LDQnqloetrVYJMnmF_PAVg.text: Am I a student? Yes.  Do l like eating out? Yes.  Do I like good value for money? Yes.  Do I love fresh mussels? Yes!! Do I like Mussel Inn Restaurant? Definitely!   Good crusty bread (served warm), amazing prices. Could easily split a big pot of mussels between two (if you're good enough friends) for about a fiver each. Now I haven't tried any other dishes here besides the mussels, but I'm assuming they are pretty good.   Overall I really like this place. It doesn't get 5 stars because well, I can think of better Edinburgh based seafood places and well, the decor is a little lame! The service is okay, but the experience is good.   Like!

Jx58C57A09U21CUXx1T2jg.text: We had a very disappointing visit to the Mussel Inn. The soup that I had to start was extremely poor. The mussels were better, but it made us "kind of sad that I can no longer keep it in my mind as the holy grail of mussel places."   Overall, we said: "It's an extremely popular place, as was evidenced by the lively and diverse crowd packed in for a busy lunchtime service, but I was pretty underwhelmed by the quality, particularly of the soup."

qQ2mmqagykWXI5kRxqRgaw.text: I had heard good things about this place before I managed to go to it. My best friend would come to Edinburgh regularly for the rugby and would rave about the mussels in this restaurant. So I checked it out!  The atmosphere is really laid back and really comfortable. It's the sort of place you don't need to get really dressed up for, go in wearing a hoody and fat-ants and you're just fine. You have to have mussels when you're here, they're really yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

edXnLN0SsmIWSJOBw2xlZw.text: With branches in Edinburgh and Glasgow, the Mussel Inn has long been established as a good seafood restaurant. But with freshly opened Seadogs muscling in on Mussel Inn's turf, it might have to up its game just a little.  Saying that, I always find this establshment consistently good, with efficient service as Eleanor suggested. With its plain but pleasant decor and no fuss approach to dining, their menu is easy enough to figure out. You have the option of choosing mussles ans scallops with a variety of delicious sauces which are always creamy and bring out the flavour of the seafood without drowning them. I have vowed to try them all in my time but can recommend the cheesy sauce and, a more recent venture, the spicier option.   As Eleanor rightly outlined, Mussel Inn seems to cater well to its potential business customers who are looking for a quick but tasty lunch. It's also a good place to try seafood for the first time as their mussels are delicious, but if you happen to chicken out they also do pasta. It's a messy first date because, if you're like me, you will practically shove your face in that bowl to hoover the gorgeous mussels up, but I quite like the hands on approach to dining! A firm favourite, it still goes does swimmingly well.

photos.caption: Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

_HSndw9vU8XGc_uFOqxWDQ.text: I suppose it's time for one of those reviews where you just don't see what everyone else really loved. Ok here goes: First off I have nothing major-negative to say , ok that's done. I heard about this place and really wanted to try it so once I did I had high expectations. It was good food, I had the Moroccan mussels the big one, and it was tasty and very spicy which I liked. The broth was also good, not great but good. Over all it was a good meal , if not a little pricy for me. The menu is not to big not to small. Beer goes well with the mussel pot I think. You have the wine sauce they are cooked in, so another glass of wine kind of over does it. A beer compliments it very well I believe . So it's a good restaurant , kind service, fresh seafood. I give it a thumbs up, if your visiting or just love locally harvested mussels go here!

wi2OjUJae5Fnm20cRrOWDA.text: Delicious mussels! Good service, nice atmosphere. Good bread.  I had a wonderful time.   I guess it's a bit crowded and I'm not in love with the decor, but it's solid.

1k0OJhxJAf6yWAuD5BN6pA.text: I had read a lot about this place and came to it with high expectations. I was not disappointed. My joy started when the smell of the delicious steamed mussels hit me as I walked in the door. It made me more hungry. I had the mussels steamed in white wine, shallots and cream. A half kilo was the perfect size (35 in all). A buddy had the Moroccan style and they were even better -- amazing how the flavor infused the mussels. great for dipping bread into.   Argula heavy house salad and a value priced Sauvignon Blanc rounded out the dinner. The starter of raw oysters was just ok -- not as good as the ones I get on the east coast of the USA. Still a great dinner experience. Would go back in a heart beat. It was the best dining experience we had in Edinburgh.

S6m8VtAS5mu0M3bLGNVzTA.text: I came here almost four years ago when I first visited Edinburgh. This time I went as I stopped by Edinburgh on my way up north, and they actually sat me at the same table. Such coincidence! I had fond memories of the mussels here, and they again did not disappoint. I got the lunch deal so a plate of mussels with salad and bread. I also ordered a seafood chowder. The chowder was quite watery, although the taste was lovely. The flavors were predominately from the fish in the soup, and I enjoyed it. The mussels (I got with shallots) were fresh and delicious, and I mopped up the left over sauce with the bread.

-YZ8_eAH-idsn8XuZFF7XA.text: Pretty nice place for Mussels or sea food.  Great service and resonable prices.

p8ByQSQJOjZTWyk1D_TgPw.text: This place gets lots of positive reviews.  It's a tourist trap.  Sorry.  Mussels were OK.  I've had better in a dozen other restaurants.  It all comes to the broth.  The shallot creme broth looked like skim milk and didn't have a ton of flavor.  Some toasted / grilled crusty bread is usually what I like but instead you just get some regular old table bread.  The mussels were fine, pretty small.  I also got the lobster Thermidor.  It was 17 quid for half of one.  I'm from New England so I'm pretty used to eating lobster.   It was very tiny.  The Maine you would have to legally throw them back at that size.  Definitely less than a pound.  It was served over a sad looking salad and a few potatoes.   Recommendation:  If you go, just get the mussels.  Otherwise pass.   It must pay to be in Go Scotland! books or something.

NVxr2Vnsf5kQAnBpJz3rjQ.text: We stopped in for the express lunch special- mussels (with choice of sauce), fries and a bottle of Carlsberg. It was great. Staff could have been friendlier but I guess we were there close to closing time.

photos.caption: Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Lunch special.

XdGJEU0ELsTHGXc5_EsGJg.text: We really enjoyed our meal. I had the spicy fish stew, which really hit the spot on a chilly evening and the mr had a bucket o mussels. Tasty and fresh. Our server was super friendly and the atmosphere fun and casual.

eGlUURBFQsIhkesEyX5Q7w.text: i love the mussels very much! taste very good.  they have a lunch deal which offer a good price and really filling.  the service is great! feel warm!  definitely will visit again

iedKtWqRgsKHEZwMWSFYyw.text: Tremendous experience, one we will never forget! Mussels are delicious- we loved their choice of flavors- the price was wonderfully reasonable! We hope to make it back one day!

zd-bmSOhRbqn_UkofXCvZA.text: I have nothing negative to say about my trip to the mussel inn. Oysters to start and then amazing mussels in a blue cheese sauce for main. Great service and great value!

a691Ql-7KDO9HS1Uzc0Fmg.text: Fresh and delicious seafood at reasonable prices. Service was very good. Make reservations bec they book up fast.

KTyrcGvR8indjDqMttRUyA.text: really like the seafood here especailly hot seafood platter  in the meantime,the owner is really nice and easy talking

photos.caption: Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. hot seafood platter！

3Pus7PV1-QCcXbj1aGq5tA.text: Great and fresh food!so popular that it was full even at lunch time.Lucky we had booked a table in advanced. We ordered a kilo mussel which was fresh and not fishy at all! And the seabass and shellfish pasta were delicious too. Although the oysters disappointed me skittle bit still it was a great restaurant and the lunch menu there was a surprise with lower price.totally worth a try.

7srMkZwZeB8LrM8JsqSIyw.text: While my sis and I were in the early stages of a weeklong holiday through Scotland, we needed a place to eat for dinner on the first night. Walking around the streets of Glasgow, we stumbled upon this place. After examining the menu we gave it a shot.   Looking around at the other tables, my sis was intrigued when we saw that several tables were dining with giant pots of mussels. I am usually not a big fan of the dish, but she was willing to give them a shot. I settled on a seafood chowder for an app and a Crab Pasta (White crab meat cooked in lime, chilli and coriander) for a main dish.  Just an opinion: maybe it's just the character of European chefs, but these dishes definitely tasted different and way better than plates that would be served from home. The chowder tasted fresh, meatier and had just the right spice to it. The Crab pasta was served with angel hair pasta (I expected bigger noodles but this dish turned out ok). My sis feasted on the pot of clams.  The waitress was great and the service time was fast. We both had happy stomachs after that night. We were planning on visiting Edinburgh later on in the trip so naturally visiting the other restaurant was in the plans. After finding the place we wandered in and had high expectations.  On our second trip, my sis ended up ordering and feasting on the same pot of mussels. I ended up ordering a different set of dishes: Fish Cakes (with mixed leaves served with a light lemon and saffron mayonnaise) for an app and Sea Bass (grilled fillet served on a rocket, feta, warm new potato and roasted red pepper salad, drizzled with balsamic dressing) for a main course. Both dishes exceeded expectations.   The only bad part about our second visit was how slow the service was. We were the first people to get seated when the place opened that day but must have waited a while to get served. Not to mention how long we sat there waiting for the check.  All in all, a mixed bag of a review. The food was excellent both times we were there; however the service at the Edinburgh restaurant could have used a bit of improvement.

akglFx7O_74I25U1Nm5dBQ.text: We were visiting Edinburgh for a few days and a friend recommened this place. And now we thank her!! One of the best seafood places I have been to!   The Mussels are apparently their specialty, but honestly, everything here is delicious! So delicious we had to come back!   Their seafood is extremely fresh and everything is so tasty. I'm not a big fan of Chowder, but I tasted some of my friend's and it was great!   The price is extremely resonable, cheap actually.   The service is top notch, everyone is so friendly and efficient.   Definitely recommend this place!

Xqwkzdx--366egKHYHjsDQ.text: Get here early is you want all menu options. I had the mussels and they were excellent. This is the best place to eat in all of Edinburgh and I will definitely be back!

QrUEtamVR11300yeUUoEyg.text: Seriously good mussels. Lick your fingers kind of place.  The shallot sauce, the mussels the presentation, the price  - Great.  I had some scallops, they were cooked very good, not rubbery, juicy and tasty.   I also had the sea bass dish once, it was lovely but only served one fillet, which unfortunately didn't fill me up as much and expensive for what you get... but no worries, nothing a 1/2 kilo pot of their great mussels cant fix.   The Edinburgh Restaurant feels like a greek taverna and had a nice atmosphere.   I love the location too, centre of Edinburgh on the back pebbled Rose street.   Enjoy.

mIeyaD_yD4MlSkAXYs28JQ.text: I've been here twice, once a few years ago for date night and a few days ago when I was back up in Edinburgh. Have to say it checks all the boxes to satisfy my obsession with top-quality seafood at reasonable prices. This time, I had the special mussels - lemongrass and ginger - and some oysters. Oysters here are one of the best values I've seen in the UK 9 for 6, which a few years ago would have seemed egregious to me, but it's a good price for Britain, especially considering these were perfectly shucked, no popped bellies, no shell shrapnel and plenty of delicious liquor in the shells. Sadly, the mussels were overcooked when they arrived, but the friendly-if-frenzied server made sure the problem was corrected immediately and the second attempt yielded a perfect pot.  The location in New Town makes this place great for visitors who want a break from the usual slew of frozen pre-packed chain food on offer in many of the nearby places, at prices that don't break the bank. It's close the major tourist attractions and Waverley Station. Definitely worth a visit.

_aV9HBCyOhcpZNucsFrLLA.text: My other half and I had gone regularly to Mussel Inn when we first got together but fell out of love really because kids came along and we moved to Leith. We returned for the first time in about 10 years.  Know what? Liked it - didn't love it; it's been overtaken by other venues. Good quality food served simply.  Lots of seafood options (with a couple of burger, pasta options) with the focus on kilos of fresh mussels with a range of tasty sauces.  I usually enjoy the iced oysters but this time went for the 6 "queenies" (scallops) which were grilled with garlic butter; delicious!  Decent puddings; good selection of wine; friendly service; reasonably priced.

8AQhe3hti77L2KeWLSZyLQ.text: We split a kilo of mussels, a shellfish pasta, and a bowl of soup between two people. The mussels were great, but the pasta was overcooked. Decent meal but nothing to rave about.

photos.caption: Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. shellfish pasta

pCnZ-25A_KoGxfFyOvvl8w.text: Friendly and welcoming place! Good food. Mussel is highly recommended, very frsh.  And its not expensive!

photos.caption: Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Crab pasta
Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mussel in white wine
Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Fish stew

exo51EHa54YJpyvRDefw9g.text: I will sing the praises of this lunchtime deal to anyone who will listen. 7.95 for a half kilo pot of mussels AND chips/salad AND a glass of wine/beer/soft drink. Amazing.  Last visit a mate and I sat al fresco and got to enjoy Rose St in the sunshine, which was a treat in itself and even more so glass of white wine in hand. He went for the roasted red pepper and pesto mussel pot and I went for the white wine and garlic. Both were delicious, with hardly any closed shells. They also keep you well topped up with dunkably soft bread that I ate far too much of whilst trying to soak up every last drop of the sauce.  There's a wide variety of other things on the menu, even for non-mussel-lovers who've been dragged along. Friendly staff will put a smile on your face too - they're v efficient at turning tables over without hurrying you and attentive even when the place was rammed.  Give it a try - the lunch deal is just such good value, you might pull a mussel! (A pun too far?! Yeah, probably should've quit while I was ahead. Ahem I'll be off now).

qzC1IGDVEhHfRshkkryvNA.text: I was totally blown away by the food.  Extremely creative and fresh food, wonderful service, and a sinful ice cream-espresso-whisky affogato.

WNEgi5WcKnc92FvFIhxKxg.text: Delicious mussels and perfect for an afternoon bite!  Was craving something filling but not too heavy and this was perfect.  Didn't have a reservation but the restaurant was willing to provide a table that had been reserved for a later time. Our group ordered the goat cheese starter along with crab salad and fish cakes which were great with a 1/2 k of shallot mussels.  Not too much but definitely enough. This was a great find while checking out the sights.

9eq7SvqUNkbqVfvgU9AYJQ.text: The food here is excellent and the prices are low. It's no wonder it has a 5 star review. We didn't have reservations but only ended up waiting 2 minutes. Very good atmosphere with great service. We had fresh oysters on the half shell and mussels for dinner. Oysters were only 8 for 6 and 6 for 1/2 kilo of mussels!! I could have ate twice as much as I did but the wife wanted dessert. We tried 3 desserts and we didn't go wrong with any of them. If those were in indication of the rest they are all excellent choices. In all I would definitely come here again.

mvNnmd2TOyhkRWhGQaT25w.text: Great seafood place with affordable price. The Pan Fried King Scallops was amazing! Definitely will come back again

photos.caption: Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

MjrKBOJJsy0hb1bmCoQgMQ.text: Recommend lunch quickie - mussel bowl at very good price and the food there is just delicious! Seafood fans should definitely go have a try! This restaurant is obviously very famous, it was full when I went there for lunch twice after 1 p.m.

photos.caption: Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

66X2RTACgoI8ugfVwb7VYg.text: A must for the seafood fan in Edinburgh who doesn't have time to get out to the coast! Mussel Inn is a lovely, friendly seafood restaurant in New Town, right off of Princes Street. Stepping inside immediately evokes the feeling that you're in a seaside town.   Of course, try the Mussels! Order by the kilo or half kilo-- they also have bowl portions for lunch. I opted for the blue cheese and bacon mussels, but there are a selection of broths to choose from.  Their seafood chowder is also really fantastic.   Super friendly establishment. Very reasonably priced, despite being near the tourist stip.

photos.caption: Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

HtewnNa6n1myl1CIU802aw.text: When my friend and I decided to visit Edinburgh for a long weekend, I looked at places we would visit and eat at. Mussell inn was top of our list!  I'd been here twice before, but my friend had never been, so on the day of arrival, the hotel concierge directed us to the restaurant which was in walking distance from the Waldorf Astoria.   But we found it wasn't open yet (think they close between 3-5pm) so we went to a coffee shop for a while.  When they opened, we went in and having not booked a table, they gave us a table but said we only had two hours. That was fine.  We ordered starters, my friend had whitebait and I had oysters! They were really good! Then we both had bowls of mussels in different flavours, they were delicious. We were given basket of bread with the main.  I recommend this place, plus you should ring up an book a table if there are a lot of you or you want a table at a particular time!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mussel inn
Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Another bowl of mussels
Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mussels

djjL_Ck-ggqaM8KctgnLZw.text: This was delicious! I really recommend it, we enjoyed all plates!! The soup that we ordered was extremely tasty and was perfect for the cold day.  Everything was wonderful

6YAZSkRsNNDecyExp2yl9A.text: Maybe I'm just paranoid, but I get really, really nervous when I'm traveling and wind up eating in tourist central. In most cities, you really wind up with only two options: You're either paying through the nose for decent food or paying a smaller amount for nastiness.  I'm happy to say that Mussel Inn didn't veer too far in either direction; our mussels were nicely spiced, steamed and flavorful, with perfectly solid service and a kind front of house that found us a table on a very busy evening. And prices were far from unreasonable; not cheap but not nearly as horrifying as I expected. Made for a satisfying meal downtown.

photos.caption: Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

HAOkqIFT5ZBqI-3aQV2UyQ.text: Best seafood I've ever enjoyed!  Delicious mussels in a shallot, wine and cream broth. The broiled sea bass was perfection. Enjoyed the local ale as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Great local ale!
Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Great mussels and seafood

xK90icB2u61welF53yQmWA.text: Stumbled across this restaurant while looking for a place to eat with some character. The place looks like many busy seafood restaurants you may find along the coast: small tables very close one to another. The food was very satisfactory both in terms of quality and quantity. Given the name of the place we had mussels and we were satisfied. The soups we had as starters were very tasty and we would recommend the sea chowder for sure. The waiter was very kind and capable. The price was adequate to the quality, meaning that it is not expansive if one keeps in mind that good sea food cannot sell for the same price as chicken!

0f9QOsYZUwDFA4Yp7CvgXQ.text: Do you like mussels? No, even if you think you don't like mussels, you need to visit this place and try their mussels! Seriously!! No, seriously!!! (Well, at least that's what my partner would say after devouring half a kilo of mussels for less than 7 with lots of bread for dipping in their "juice", which is extremely tasty!)  The must try dish are the mussels! Five flavours: natural (their own juice), Shallot (my favourite! White wine, garlic, shallots, cream), Roasted peppers, Moroccan, and Blue Cheese!   According to their menu: "Our mussels are grown on ropes in sea lochs on the West of Scotland and the Shetland Isles. They feed naturally in the plankton rich waters. Sustainability and care for the environment are of utmost importance to our growers."  There is a very good selection of starters as well, along with one or two day specials, and soup of the day. More main dishes of course, including even a burger, scallops etc.   This time I tried their crab pasta: white crab meat cooked in lime, chilli and coriander! It wasn't hot like some Indian dishes, but it was medium spicy! The pasta looked more like noodles, and it was quite filling surprisingly! (I did share it with my partner so that we both try mussels!)   The waiting staff are very friendly and polite, they might be quite busy from time to time.   Make sure you book in advance to avoid disappointment or wait time. You'll get a window of about two hours, the service is fast and the location is ideal in the city centre (no sea-views unfortunately, but the decoration could be from a fisher's place next to the sea ;-) ).   Already looking forward to my next visit!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mussels pot
Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. White crab pasta !!! With chilli! Be aware

fG02m8FW2eTS2CVrFIPV9g.text: When my aunt and I went to Scotland we found this place in the travel books and decided to try it.  It had really good reviews.  And they were not wrong.  We ordered a pot of mussels with white wine and cream and they kept refilling the bread, which was fresh and used it to dip the sauce with.  We had to go a second time after that.  The next time I went to Scotland with a friend while backpacking, and I had to drag her to this place.  She agreed but had no idea why I was so excited to go.  We didn't have a reservation, but were nice enough to give us a small table since it was just the two of us.  The server took our orders and I was eager for my friend to try it.  The mussels came to our table hot and steaming from the pot, and as my friend had her first bite, her eyes lit up,  scooched the pot closer to her side of the table and used the fork to stab my hand whenever I reached over for some and said "None for you!  Its all mine!" And of course we went a second time that week!  I don't know what it was, but I think the rain added to the experience of eating that pot of mussels.  It was just so warm and cozy, oh! and the service was great too!

6oE4TZ_zWPtJqUuDpt1E-g.text: So, I should start this off by saying that I don't like Mussels and this review is for those of you who may be hesitant about going here if you don't eat Mussels. While the menu is clearly for the Mussel crowd, it's not the only thing they have. I went her with my wife and got their lunch special. I got the seafood chowder while my wife gobbled down her half-kilo of mussels (which by the way, she loved). I was very impressed by the chowder and despite not eating a single mussel, I had a very enjoyable and filling meal. They do offer some alternatives like a steak burger, if fish is not your thing, so don't worry if a friend invites you to eat here because there are options for everyone!

photos.caption: Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Seafood chowder

oqBVeV2c449nL-70RW0l-A.text: After a great day at the Edinburgh festival my partner and I went to Mussel Inn on rose street. We sat outside till 8pm when we had finished.   We had queen scallops for a starter and haggis bonbons. The scallops were a tad small for the price tag of 8.95.   The mains were the 1/2 kg of mussels one with the shallot sauce the other roasted pepper both sauces were ok but a little watery.  All and all pretty good and would definitely come back but prob have the 1kg of mussels with an extra portion of bread.

szJa1mERzXYGfDlro3u09g.text: If you're in the mood for some mussels or just seafood, this is one of the best places to be. My friend and I found the Mussel Inn by chance as we were walking around New Town.  It was pretty busy when we went but the staff was so friendly and accommodating that we didn't mind the wait. The atmosphere is casual and has a bit of a nautical theme (obviously) but we cared little for them mostly because we were distracted by the food around us!  We both ordered a meal of half-kilo mussels in a shallot and a natural sauce. They were definitely fresh and light, but also filling with great flavor! The portion sizes were just right and price-wise it's pretty good. Of course, if you're not one for mussels, then there are other dishes to try that are just as good :)  The food is simple and clean but full of flavor with a great wait staff! Would definitely come back and recommend to friends if they haven't got the time to hit the coast xx

nPfRSAHaIvE6hfB2XD4gqA.text: Really ought to be Six Stars. The seafood chowder is frankly, rather astonishing.  In Edinburgh? Hungry? Don't miss the Mussel Inn.

1nrokER2LJ6Gng1vsJYO2A.text: Stumbled upon this little restaurant by accident and loved it. Service was quick, professional and friendly. Had the crevettes as a starter, good though could have used a touch of something more to make it great, maybe a more originally seasoned dipping sauce. As a main went for the mussels which were very nice. Good wine selection as well

8U1LVRg8fzvB7E6WZnQAQA.text: Pretty good. Went here on the last night in Edinburgh after the Festival Fringe. We saw tables available outside, and went inside, who said the wait for a table would be about an hour. I asked, "what about outside?" and she took us there immediately. Not sure what that was about.  Let's talk about the haggis bonbons. Obviously, the words "haggis" and "bonbons" don't belong in the same dish. Neither does "spicy tomato sauce". Honestly, one of the best appetizers I've had in a while. It shouldn't go together, but it does. Extremely well!   The shellfish pasta, was however, less exciting. 3/4 of the mussels in it were closed. The ones that were were only cooked in their own juice, so they didn't have very much flavor. My pasta was a tad overcooked if I'm being picky. The scallops in particular in that dish were excellent, if it had a redeeming factor.  Good dinner overall. A little pricey, but good for a moderate night out in New Town.

yqc-FOqsWZbLdVmuoMZgKQ.text: Fresh upscale sophisticated seafood on a budget? This is the place to come. My family ordered a bucket of mussels, white crab pasta, and chowda. Comes with complimentary bread. All were really, really fantastic.  I'd definitely recommend the mussels-- quite inexpensive and keeps your hands & mouth busy for a while! (Although, why wouldn't you order mussels at the mussel inn?????)

iD0udy3PuuAjl7Zwlvxmuw.text: It's ok. I feels touristy and I guess it ranks high to keep the tourists using yelp coming. But nothing stands out. Not the food or ambience. Nothing is bad either. I'm just not sure it's worth a trip.

0Swe3y8FJKU5qbJaEAnQpw.text: A very casual atmosphere, fantastic service and delicious food. We shared 6 oysters, a kilo of mussels in the shallot sauce and the king scallop entree. All of the seafood was very fresh and delicious. The waitstaff was extremely attentive, which has not been our general experience in the U.K. Great little spot off the main drag.

6gAnzQQrgQZcq_BaheMb2g.text: We stumbled on this restaurant and it was a wonderful stumble. While in Edinburgh we were interested in eating seafood and Mussel Inn was a great find! This is one of two locations- the first one being in Glasgow. The style of the menu sort of makes it look like a chain restaurant but it isnt, and nothing else makes it seem that way.  We ate mussels (of course!)- 'natural' style - half a kilo is about 30 and that was the right amount for one person. We also ordered the Hot Seafood platter which was an enormous amount of food- all perfectly well done, and a Caesar salad which had three whole anchovies layers across it- more seafood! The wine list was surprisingly extensive. This place was hopping and we were able to walk in and get a table but you might want to call ahead for a reservation.

photos.caption: Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Dessert menu
Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Hot Seafood Platter
Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Drink menu

eklfZUkTmTIOja5iaQik1A.text: We tried to get in this restaurant before but it was just to busy BUT tonight we only had 10-15 min wait; Bruce had read good reviews on it! It is small inside but there is more seating outside but the rain was on and off so most wanted inside.  We ordered the seafood soup.. in a thin white cream sauce with fish pieces and potatoes; good but not that good.  Then we order the seafood pasta with prawns (shrimp), mussels and scallops but there was no scallops but about 18-20 mussels and about 4/5 shrimp. The sauce was good and believe it or not, not a ton of pasta (which is good) when we left I looked at menu to see if pasta was suppose to have scallops and it was but they were out but the mussels were definitely in! Mussels from the Shetland Island according to the chalk board.

photos.caption: Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mussels and pawn pasta
Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Seafood soup
Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

mM_2jUFqMK70YQh78zTLcQ.text: I knew I wanted some good seafood while visiting Edinburgh. I stumbled upon Mussel Inn while researching online before our trip and made a reservation. We arrived earlier than our reservation time but they were able to take us to our table. We tried some oysters as an appetizer. This was my first tome trying oysters so I didn't have anything to compare it to but they were good. For our meal, we both ordered an 1/2 kg of mussels. I've never ordered mussels like this before so I wasn't sure what to expect. It was a ton of food and really great value. We loved both mussel pots (shallot and red pepper). This was one of our favorite meals during our trip and if we ever visit again we will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Oyster
Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mussels
Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mussels

fHPcynsL2o9W21IK_IWj3w.text: Can not recommend highly enough! I never associated Scotland with seafood, but these were possibly the best mussels I have ever had. We got there a bit before they opened, and you know it must be good when there were other parties lining up before open as well!   Due to the unseasonably warm weather, we were told that each person could only half a half kilo of mussels each. We had no reference of what that meant, but I think it was the perfect amount for a hungry family of four :) We got a kilo of mussels in shallot sauce which came in a big pot. The sauce adds flavor without being too heavy. Pro tip: save some of the complimentary bread to dip into the sauce and eat with the mussels...sooooo good!! We also got the shellfish pasta as well as the hot seafood platter which were also excellent. Not only is the seafood fresh, but the pasta was fresh as well. For dessert, we got the rocky road parfait, which was recommended by our waiter. It was something I've never had before, and while I'm glad I tried it, I'm not sure I would order it again.

photos.caption: Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. rocky road parfait
Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. hot seafood platter
Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. 1kilo mussels with shallot sauce

d522v53Ag8lWK9XX8A_4Yw.text: A few of my friends recommended the Mussel Inn, a restaurant that specializes in seafood. The restaurant has indoor and outdoor seating.   For drinks, they had wine, beer, liquer, non alcoholic beverages, and after night drinks. We shared a bottle of Chardonnay, Macon Village. In addition to wine, I ordered a Thistly Cross Cider, which was sweet, tart, and smooth. It reminded me of Angry Orchard Hard Cider.   For dinner, I wanted the Special of the Day: Grilled Seabream Fillet Served on a Mixed Seafood Risotto but it was sold out. I ended up getting a Seafood Chowder and Caesar Salad. The Seafood Chowder consisted of smoky and creamy chowder made with salmon, seabass, celery, onion, potato, and fresh herbs. The Caesar Salad consisted of baby gem lettuce, parmesan, garlic croutons tossed in homemade Caesar dressing and garnished with white anchovies. I didn't like how the baby gem lettuce wasn't very fresh or the taste of the salad dressing.  For dinner, my family shared the Grilled Oysters, Pot of Kilo Mussels - Shallot, Queen Scallops, and Shellfish Pasta. The Grilled Oysters (without the Cheese and Bacon), even after grilled, maintained a briny and grassy flavor. The Pot of Mussels - Shallots consisted of steamed mussels in a flavorful broth made of white wine, garlic, shallots, and cream. The Queen Scallops consisted of queen scallops served on shells grilled in garlic butter. The scallops were delicious but bitsized and not filling. The shellfish pasta consisted of linguine pasta topped with mussels, tiger prawns, and queen scallops that were cooked and poached in housemade shellfish bisque.   We finished our meal with two desserts - Warm Sticky Date Pudding and Banana Walnut Cake. The Warm Sticky Date Pudding was served with toffee sauce and vanilla ice cream. The Banana Walnut Cake was served warm with chopped walnuts, fresh cream and white chocolate sauce. I enjoyed the flavors of Warm Sticky Date Pudding more.

e-45ZGWmM3V8BB_1y8Q6Dw.text: Location is great and friendly service. We ordered the Lunchtime Quickie menu and they're pretty decent with very reasonable price.

3UAjpWgb3xurShBEC6RPeQ.text: We had a reservation and dropped in a little bit too early. No chance to get a seat before head because the place was packed. Later when we came back on time, I noticed that most of the guests where tourists mostly Asians, but that's not the reason for only a two star rating. Also not because of the staff who was friendly and speedy. No, it was the quality of food. It was just ... average, not very creative, just to feed some tourists I suppose.

Zf1WCFCoPLuG39xSWIxn-Q.text: We stopped in on a recommendation of the sales folks at TK Maxx. They said, "walk down Rose Street to Mussel Inn and hope for a table".  We got the last table for lunch. Patricia was our server, she was so helpful and happy.  We ordered the crayfish salad special, and two of the daily specials: Mussels and salad; Seafood Chowder and fries. Our tummies were filled with deliciousness. Just a delightful afternoon!

_FAyQAs96R7DIH0HoRfQCg.text: Picked this place for lunch because I love seafood and the reviews were great. Modern decor, cramped cafeteria style tables.  Noisy, don't plan on savoring a nice dinner! I ordered grilled scallops, they were over cooked and strangely tasteless. They were served on a bed of greens, 5 scallops for21,was a bit overpriced! The chocolate mousse was the best part of the meal. Rich and flavorful. I ordered tea, got a teabag and barely hot enough water. . Service good, not super-attentive. Personally, I would go elsewhere.....

XHriehTFTtIzFCHKNznhkg.text: We tried to get in on. Sunsay but it was booked and based on the reviews and the menu, we weren't surprised.  When we did get in this evening, we were somewhat let down. We weren't given much of a chance to linger over our meal as thjngs came too promptly.  Oddly, we waited 15 minutes for the check.  The scallops  were tasty and filling while thentiger prawns were merely okay. The desserts erre bettrr although the rocky road parfait lacked rocks and was jot jn a parfait glass, more like slices of ice cream stacked one atop the other.  Our staff was quick and efficient althogh not terribly personable as they rushed from table to table.

yTjJpgV6d97RnbzzL6Cv6w.text: It lives up to its name serving half kilogram pots of mussels with your choice of sauces/broths. They have a good value "pre-theater dinner" menu with 2 courses for 10.95 or with dessert 13.95 [see photo of this menu]. We had to ask for this menu- I guess they don't push it. The seafood chowder, the mussels and the salad that came with it (you can choose to have French fries [chips] instead of the salad) were all delicious. The cake we chose for dessert was okay but not fabulous.

photos.caption: Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pre-theater menu
Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cake
Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The salad that comes with the pot of mussels or you can get French fries [chips]

_MUroy-w7rqdfQuyUl4DIg.text: Make sure you make a reservation as it's always full.  Amazing food. Watch out for the portion though as kilo pot is more than it sounds. You may want to consider ordering 2 x half a kilo as the price difference is small and you will get to try different flavors.  Tables are relatively small and packed. Not very comfy but hey we're here for mussels, no one cares about the seats!  Went with my mum once when she's visiting Edinburgh a year ago and she's still talking about how much she wanna go to Mussel Inn again!

3MWYn9qCkyww1mri9Q-Zpg.text: Likely the best deal for mussels in the touristy area of Princes Street.   I got half a kilo of mussels with shallots for 7.10 with bread included.  They write down where they sourced their mussels each day.  I get ones from Fograbekk north roe which they tell me is close to the Shetland Islands.  Mussels were decent but I prefer the Australian ones they are bigger and more supple

photos.caption: Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Half kilo mussel

eEHjnyEBapIwsd1tOMZRTw.text: I was craving some seafood so decided to stop in here around noon rather than a pub or other local restaurant. It was completely empty inside but they still asked me if I had a reservation (more on that later).   To start I had 3 oysters and the queen scallops. The scallops were OK, they didn't have much flavor and several were gritty from the sand they contained. The oysters were excellent and tasted like a fresh sea breeze near the shore. I never knew it was possible to taste something so distinct, fresh, and neat, yet there it was. I should have ordered a dozen.  For the main course I decided on the 1/2 kilo of mussels in the blue cheese sauce, which was made with blue cheese, cream, and bacon. It was very flavorful and the mussels were cooked well, although there were one or two which were unopened. I ate almost the whole thing, so if you're looking to share with someone else I recommend the full kilo for two people.  Service was very good and attentive, even though it was completely full when I left. So if you show up around noon, you should be good. If you show up around 12:45 or 1, expect that it will be packed. Almost every seat was full when I left, and the reservation question suddenly made a lot of sense.  Overall it was pretty good, if the prices were lower I would rate it higher. The only real negative was that my clothes, hair, and skin smelled completely of the restaurant for hours after I left.

0z7qAFvcVdZxfMCLlqf1jA.text: Came here excited to try seafood from Scotland after hearing rave reviews about it but were completely disappointed.  Came here on the recommendation of our tour guide. We had an evening tour scheduled for 8pm so we gave ourselves an hour and 45 minutes to eat. Ordered grilled oysters, raw oysters and two half kilos of mussels. Our food took SO long to get to us and we watched multiple tables who were seated after us get their entire meal before us. We mentioned to the waiter that we had to get to a tour and asked if he could let the kitchen know we were in a bit of a rush now. Our food did not come until about 7:40 so we literally only had 5 minutes to eat before we had to leave to get to our tour. When we brought it up to the waiter he admitted it was his fault and apologized but the least he could have done was take a glass of wine off our bill. Also the mussels were below average. Not worth it.

yC7kjllUHyZ3Kmd2OJbqjA.text: My husband and I went here for dinner to celebrate our anniversary. The staff was friendly and were accommodating to seat us in the front area until a dining room table was available.    We ordered the fried goats cheese appetizer (yum), the shallot mussel pot (double yum), and the lobster thermidor (triple yum). The lobster was a special and was the highlight of our meal.     I only gave 4 stars due to the lack of ambience in the place. We were there at 9 PM but the lights were on throughout the restaurant full blast. This place would have much better ambience if they dimmed the lights down in the evenings.

photos.caption: Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Lobster thermidor
Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Scallion mussels

sZgJkmzrTYINUvLyh2H5-g.text: Nice atmosphere, friendly staff, underwhelming food. The Caesar Salad was tasty but the lettuce was wilted. The Seafood Pasta was good but not very flavourful. Perhaps my expectations were too high but I found myself wanting more out of the experience.

8ZDpBAR8jNWFFGzgMgZfeQ.text: One of the best seafood I have ever had! This restaurant was truly one of the highlights of our trip at Edinburgh. We ordered a hot seafood platter - sauce was amazing, scallops and sea bass seared on the spot - and a shellfish pasta. We felt embarrassed but great that we finished everything in 40 minutes. Great job!  Only 15 minutes after the start of dinner it started to get busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Shellfish pasta
Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Hot seafood platter

RKm23RjjkHsanZM3A4nThA.text: We're from San Diego and it was the girl that cuts my hair who told me, I needed to eat at the Mussel Inn while in Edinburgh. I need to give her a big tip next time I get my hair done.   We found heaven in a pot of mussels steamed with shallots. I'm normally not the biggest fan of mussels; because they are often tough and, well, kind of big. The mussels at the Mussel Inn were small, but oh so tender and the broth!!!  It's to die for. We used the bread to just keep soak up the broth we couldn't get by spoon. My daughter had the seafood chowder and she couldn't stop talking about how amazing it was.   Service was great and the price was reasonable.  I need to move to Edinburgh now.

ygo83UscchrBlwG-IdzDMQ.text: A must for all Seafood fans.   The 1kg of mussels, served in a white wine, shallot and cream sauce, vanished into mouth of my hungry partner who was beaming like the cat that got the. .. well... mussels in cream!   Before this came haggis Bon Bons in a stocky tomato sauce which were lovely, as was the smoaked salmon salad.    Despite the fact that the place was packed, the waitress was lovely and very friendly and there's a great wine selection.    My steak was a little tough. .. but it serves me right for ordering steak in a fish restaurant!  Desert was heavenly chocolate orange tart so I left happy and stuffed!

photos.caption: Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mussels in cream
Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chocolate cake
Photo of Mussel Inn - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Salmon salad starter

sZHDwSkhvI_PVAiaw7Nvyg.text: It's pretty simple really,if you're in the city for a weekend or a couple of days its a must to go here. I had to wait about 15 minutes to be seated,but the turnover seems pretty quick,staff were all friendly and helpful. If you're in town just go !!

FT1UdEu5KG5UJMBEQLi2nw.text: Started with the mussels cooked in their natural juices.  These particular mussels came from the Shetland Islands.  They were fresh, tasty and similar to Penn Cove mussels at home.  Several separate broths are offered.    Next, I had scallops which had been farmed in the area.  Unlike the US, these were served with the corals.  These "Queen" scallops were very tasty though somewhat on the small side -- only a small bit per scallop.    Wines seemed to be reasonably priced and the restaurant was clean and bright.

17RzAJ3KHR45PRDEjpejmA.text: Went here with Mother and much older sister. We had a sharing platter of fresh fish and mixed shell fish. Wonderfully presented and wonderfully cooked. Mother as fussy as ever but even she agreed that I could get choice of restaurant right. Which was a first.

R0_l7VIAXMcKcwpmMLEviw.text: Mussell Inn is one of the first places I visited when I moved to Edinburgh 5 years ago and I still love it. I adore their 1kg pots! My only warning is that everyone comes out smelling like a mussel! Great food and a fun atmosphere.

YU7FbrEpohudYH_w7t9Eog.text: FABULOUS!!!! We ordered half pots of each 'flavour' and we were not disappointed! It just made us order more. Everything is fresh and prepared very well. No fancy schmancy decor on the food. Reservations a must. The place is always full. Will definitely keep going back!

2txBpAK3mee1ehmHaW5K_A.text: Wonderful food, speedy service and great staff at a reasonable price..... just remember to book ahead! been to the mussel inn twice recently and both times it was packed, still I never felt like the staff had forgotten me or that the food was rushed. I have to say thought I went for the mussels both times so I can't comment on the rest of the menu. If you like seafood you will love this place.  Will definitely be going back. Negatives are that you can be tight for space and the Greek salad had a whole block of feta in it.... but both those issues aren't enough to reduce the experience to 4 stars.

uSoeHl_eJVeZyJassKSRcw.text: horrible food, even worse service.  my mussels were crunchy.  the sand had not been expelled properly.  no rhyme nor reason to how people are seated.  there are better mussels in edinburgh.  i don't understand what all the fuss is about with this place.  it is in a relatively fun area i suppose, but that's real estate, not restaurant.

JCYRO_32DXNgnKEyjrqh9w.text: Seafood Heaven right in the middle of Edinburgh. The prices are very reasonable.   I would go there again for the mussels, the scallops, the oysters and everything else.   Go there, you cant go wrong!

_n5_7UWANVAmgj-9yT7u6Q.text: Specialising in mussels, oysters and scallops this was the first proper restaurant we headed to an we weren't disappointed withour scallop starters and 1kg pots of mussels for mains. Yummy. Lines out the door during Festival season as no bookings are taken. However turnover was pretty quick and we luckily didn't have to wait too long.

H8Vi_CdWTeumdK8L99coRA.text: The Mussel Inn is a casual family restaurant buzzing with atmosphere and appetizing smells. Although modestly decorated, the food portions are a force to be reckoned with as mussels are served in kilogram and half kilogram pots (literally!) The pots are served with fresh crusty bread which is perfect for scooping up the sauce (the shallot, garlic and white wine sauce is always a winner!). The staff are friendly and lively and an evening out will not break the bank as prices are reasonable. Mussels, scallops and oysters are the main items on offer so I would avoid this restaurant if you are allergic to shellfish.

DQe-VFEW9RLzSdmYLPp-nA.text: One of the best places to eat in Edinburgh if you like shellfish. Kilo and halk kilo pots of plump mussels. A variety of sauces you can get them cooked in and the bread to dip in the sauce is plentiful. Extremely reasonably priced and always busy, you cant go wrong!

7UoBwT8t7UwgKb10qGj7gw.text: I really enjoyed the food and the service there. The place is located on one of my favourite streets - Rose street. It is not a very big restaurant but is constantly busy. Mussel Inn has a very high image not only among the tourists but also among the locals. Loved the oysters and the pot of Moroccan Mussels I finished with the help of chilled French Chardonnay.

4lOnlUFEYQlFXIdmNASkhA.text: Went here recently with a crowd of people. Everyone agreed it's a gem  they manage to serve excellent seafood, especially mussels of course, to a very high standard while being nice and friendly even although this place is bustling with customers. The wine was great too  will definitely be going back more often.

YDRkI21C_3xPChnwty14BA.text: What can I say? This is a seafood haven right in the middle of the city! As you sit and ponder the menu, your mouth will start to water as the pots of mussels on their way to other hungry diners pass you by. These are truly delicious, with different sauces available. Mop up every last drop with some bread, or enjoy other seafood such as oysters and scallops. Pudding to be recommended, and in the summer the tables outside are great for people watching.

XnhObwWLVYvn5vk-TVQ56Q.text: a warm, friendly and inviting place to go. it is reasonably priced. the staff are very attentive as well as friendly. Defo recommend

4EuRZnt1vJOYyzB5hgTV9A.text: This is an excellent seafood restaurant. They have a good range of fish and shellfish dishes, extremely rapid service and the food itself is delicious.

S0hSiFaQtHGcqP-hCaZZpA.text: If you want really good seafood, then you'd best go to Leith... but as far as centre of Edinburgh restaurants go, this is a good eat. There is really only one serious option on the menu, the big bucket of Mussels!

BuDv7U_55tIXkZX9qPr6RA.text: First time a went here we were seated for dinner on high stools in the bar/waiting area, fair enough as it was busy, food was OK but a little on the shy side. Good enough to pre-book for my birthday though. Returning for my Birthday our party of seven where tightly squeezed into a corner seating area, but we set to ordering and enjoying the evening. I and another of our party ordered scallops as a main. The first bite for my guest was into a gritty scallop, so she called over the waitress who took it away and offered a replacement, which was declined. My first scallop was fine, but the next was gritty so I called over the waitress who whisked the dish away and came back with it a few minutes later. Apparently the kitchen said there was nothing wrong as I had already eaten one and that I was just copying the other member of our party. I demanded that whoever in the kitchen wasn't prepared to believe a customer when they complain should come out and discuss it in person and maybe try one. This failed to happen and when it came to paying the bill they insisted on charging for half the dish that I hadn't eaten. This was an atrocious way to treat customers and I will never go back or recommend it to anyone. Probably the worst service I have ever had.
